citations.narrative:
An electrical cord for a heating element was connected to an extension cord and hanging within the outdoor primary
enclosure for 2 adult Black-and-White Ruffed Lemurs. A facility representative stated the heating element is not in use
and the cord was not plugged in during inspection. Failure to maintain structurally sound housing facilities for nonhuman
primates that protect them from injury, such as having electrical cords within reach, may result in adverse events such as
electrocution or strangulation. Exhibitors must design and construct housing facilities that are structurally sound for the
species of nonhuman primates housed and protect them from injury.
Correct by 28 November 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.75(a) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
An electrical cord for a heating element was connected to an extension cord and hanging within the outdoor primary 
enclosure for 2 adult Black-and-White Ruffed Lemurs. A facility representative stated the heating element is not in use 
and the cord was not plugged in during inspection. Failure to maintain structurally sound housing facilities for nonhuman 
primates that protect them from injury, such as having electrical cords within reach, may result in adverse events such as 
electrocution or strangulation. Exhibitors must design and construct housing facilities that are structurally sound for the 
species of nonhuman primates housed and protect them from injury. 
 
Correct by 28 November 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
